justification: Ignores Team B’s conservative, injury-averse profile and urgent need for stable, healthy starters. Offering a questionable committee RB and boom/bust deep threat for B’s workhorse RB misfits their preferences; zero-RB only makes sense if WR/TE return improves floor, which it doesn’t. The ‘receiving TE upgrade’ claim is inconsistent since Roberts (Tier 4) isn’t an upgrade over A’s TE options. Rationale is A-centric and lacks evidence tied to B’s incentives or playoff/win-now context. Low accept chance is stated but not well justified.
